intro: Lessingianthus ixiamensis, commonly known as the Brazilian sunflower, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers. The plant is characterized by its bright yellow to orange flowers, which bloom in clusters. It typically grows in open areas and is adapted to tropical and subtropical climates. Its botanical features make it a notable species for its ornamental value and ecological role in its native habitat.
